title: 3 Ways to Unlock an Android Tablet

steps.title: Go to https://android.com/find.
steps.content: Go to https://android.com/find . This only works if your tablet is connected to a Google account and has Find My enabled. If you use this technique, you can reset your tablet remotely. If you aren't logged in, you'll be prompted to log in with your Google account.

steps.title: Click your tablet.
steps.content: Click your tablet. You'll see a list of all the phones and tablets connected to your Google account that have Find My enabled. Click your tablet to see more options.

steps.title: Click Factory reset device.
steps.content: Click Factory reset device . Unfortunately, the site does not offer to unlock the tablet, but erasing it will also erase any PINs or passwords it has set up. [1] X Research source Once your tablet is erased, you can reboot it and set up a new PIN or passcode.

steps.title: Hold the Power button on the tablet.
steps.content: Hold the Power button on the tablet. If you can't unlock your device, your only option is to perform a factory reset. This will remove the passcode and erase all of the data on your tablet. You can restore all of your emails, purchases, app downloads, and settings by logging in again after resetting.

steps.title: Tap Power off.
steps.content: Tap Power off . This will turn off your Android.

steps.title: Hold the Volume Down button while the tablet is off.
steps.content: Hold the Volume Down button while the tablet is off. You'll be booting into Recovery Mode. The button combination for entering this mode may vary for your device.

steps.title: Press and hold the Power button while holding the Volume Down button.
steps.content: Press and hold the Power button while holding the Volume Down button. For many devices, this will boot you into the Recovery Mode launcher.

steps.title: Hold both buttons until the Start menu appears.
steps.content: Hold both buttons until the Start menu appears. If the Start menu does not appear and your device boots normally, you may need to use a different button combination to enter Recovery Mode. Search online for "recovery mode" + your Android tablet model.

steps.title: Press Volume Down until Recovery mode appears.
steps.content: Press Volume Down until Recovery mode appears. The Volume Up and Volume Down buttons will cycle through menu options.

steps.title: Press the Power button to select Recovery mode.
steps.content: Press the Power button to select Recovery mode . The Power button will select the highlighted menu option.

steps.title: Select wipe data/factory reset.
steps.content: Select wipe data/factory reset . Use the Volume Down button to highlight it and the Power button to select it.

steps.title: Select Yes.
steps.content: Select Yes . This will begin the reset process, which will delete all of your data.

steps.title: Wait while your device resets.
steps.content: Wait while your device resets. This may take 20-30 minutes.

steps.title: Start the new device setup after the reset.
steps.content: Start the new device setup after the reset. After the tablet finishes resetting, you'll be taken through the setup process you went through when you purchased it. During this process, you'll be able to log in with your Google account and restore your purchases and settings.

steps.title: Enter an incorrect PIN or pattern 5 times.
steps.content: Enter an incorrect PIN or pattern 5 times. If you're using a tablet running Android 4.4 or earlier, you can use a built-in bypass mechanism to unlock your tablet. This was removed in Android 5.0 (Lollipop). Newer Androids don't have the option to unlock their tablet with a Google account , so you'll have to try other methods to unlock it . This method requires that your tablet be connected to a wireless network .

steps.title: Tap the Forgot PIN/pattern/password button.
steps.content: Tap the Forgot PIN/pattern/password button. If this button doesn't appear after 5 incorrect attempts, your device does not support this method.

steps.title: Enter your Google address and password.
steps.content: Enter your Google address and password. Make sure this is the same Google account that you are signed in with on your tablet.

steps.title: Tap Sign In.
steps.content: Tap Sign In .

steps.title: Open Gmail on another computer or device.
steps.content: Open Gmail on another computer or device. You'll receive an email asking you to reset your passcode information.

steps.title: Open the message received from Google.
steps.content: Open the message received from Google. It may be in the Updates tab.

steps.title: Click the link in the email.
steps.content: Click the link in the email. This will take you to a form to create a new unlock code.

steps.title: Create a new PIN, password, or pattern.
steps.content: Create a new PIN, password , or pattern. This will be your new temporary unlock sequence.

steps.title: Use your new pattern to unlock your device.
steps.content: Use your new pattern to unlock your device. The tablet may take a few minutes to update with the new unlock method.

steps.title: Set a new code.
steps.content: Set a new code. Once you've unlocked the device, set a new code or pattern from the Lock Screen menu in the Settings app. [2] X Research source
